snippet: Federal agents arrested 121 migrants for deportation, the government said, starting a wave of removals of parents and children who arrived in 2014 and failed to win asylum in immigration courts.
abstract: Federal agents arrest 121 migrants, who came to United States from Central America during border surge in 2014 and failed to win asylum in immigration courts, for deportation; move is part of Obama administration's efforts to stem new wave of migrants crossing illegally.
lead_paragraph: Federal agents arrested 121 migrants for deportation, the government said, starting a wave of removals of parents and children who arrived in 2014 and failed to win asylum in immigration courts.

headline.main: Arrests Begin for Migrants Who Lost Asylum Cases
headline.print_headline: Arrests Begin for Migrants Who Lost Asylum Cases
